definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: I am curious and ask some tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 我的好奇心会促使我提出一些刁钻的问题。

sentences.english: Do your own research and ask them tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 做好你自己的研究，问他们一些刁钻的问题。

sentences.english: If he gives me one of his tricky slow balls, I'll knock it for six.
sentences.chinese: 刁钻古怪的慢球，我就给他来个一击得最高分。

sentences.english: He was just trying to stop a ball that squirmed around.
sentences.chinese: 他只是尽力去阻挡那记刁钻的射门罢了。

sentences.english: Semester selected foreign teacher of photography classes, operating small, very tricky.
sentences.chinese: 这个学期选了外教的摄影课，作业不多，却很刁钻。

sentences.english: The show's host was known for asking tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 该节目主持人以提问刁钻古怪问题而闻名。

definition: to hit the nail on the head (idiom)
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
exquisite/fine and delicate (usu. of works of art)
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
